application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
description: Demolition of existing showroom and repair workshop; mixed use redevelopment to provide a five storey building with basement for car parking, office accommodation (1273sqm) at ground and part first floor levels and up to 48 flats (50% affordable housing) on part first floor and upper floor levels with roof terrace (Outline application with approval sought for siting only)
decision_conditions: The proposal fails to provide adequate space for a 2-way access ramp, which would be likely to lead to conflict between vehicles attempting to enter and exit the car park, and result in vehicles backing onto Colonial Drive, prejudicial to highway safety. This would also be unsafe for pedestrian movement in this area. As such, the proposal is contrary to New Plan for the Environment 2004 adopted UDP policy 9.1. | Approval of the details of the design, external appearance of the building, means of access thereto and the landscaping of the site (called "the reserved matters") shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in writing before any development is commenced.  REASON:  The application is in outline form only and details of design, external appearance means of access and landscaping are reserved for future approval. | The proposed siting of the loading bay on Bollo Lane is unacceptable. Its position adjacent to and opposite two bus stops would be likely to result in vehicle movements which would conflict with the freeflow of traffic and pedestrian movement on Bollo Lane, contrary to New Plan for the Environment 2004 adopted UDP policy 9.1. | Application for the approval of all the reserved matters shall be made to the Local Planning Authority before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:  In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The proposed siting of bin stores is adjacent to a bus stop on Bollo Lane is unacceptable. The siting would not facilitate safe and convenient access for collection of waste, resulting in potential conflict of refuse vehicles and other traffic, prejudicial to highway safety. As such the proposal is contrary to New Plan for the Environment 2004 adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 9.1. | The development shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission or before the expiration of two years from the date of approval of the reserved matters to be approved, whichever is the later.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development is not considered to have made adequate provision, through planning obligations for affordable housing, highway improvements, education provision, amenity space / childrens play facilities  or community facilities, contrary to policy New Plan for the Environment 2004 adopted UDP policy 1.10. | In relation to the 'reserved matters' of design referred to in condition 1, the following shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any development is commenced:  +    Details of the internal layout, number and mix of residential unit sizes +    Details of the final number and layout of parking spaces  REASON : In order to ensure compliance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 5.3, 5.4, 5.5 and 9.1, Supplementary Planning Guidance 13 "Indoor Living Space" and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 "Accessible Ealing". | The proposal fails to provide an appropriate mix of 1, 2, 3 and 4 bedroom private and affordable units to meet local needs, contrary to policy 5.4 of the adopted UDP New Plan for the Environment 2004 and SPG 11. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policy 4.1 | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans, details of refuse and recycling storage, and waste management, in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority and shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision as approved shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living and working conditions of occupiers of the area, in the interests of the visual and general amenities of the locality and in the interests of the visual and general amenities of the locality and to meet the council's sustainability policies in accordance with adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 2.10 and 4.1 and SPG 4 Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | Development shall not begin until details of surface water and foul water drainage have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority; the scheme as approved to be carried out before any part of the development permitted is occupied.  REASON:  To ensure that adequate drainage of the site is carried out as approved, in the interests of the wider environment, in accordance with the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 2.1, 2.5 and 4.1. | The approved hard and soft landscaping works, including any method statement shall be carried out prior to first occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5, Supplementary Planning Guidance 13 "Garden Space" and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 "Trees and Development Guidelines". | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan outlining the construction details of all roofs that will accommodate landscaping in suitably designed planting areas.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 and Supplementary Planning Guidance13 "Garden Space". | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment and fences to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the appearance and security of the area in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 "Trees and Development Guidelines" and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8 "Safer Ealing". | The existing trees on the site or on adjacent sites to be retained shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  REASON:  To safeguard the trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1 and 4.5 and Supplementary Planning Guidelines 9 "Trees and Development Guidelines". | The entire root system of trees to be retained, as shown on the approved drawings, indicated by the spread of their branches, shall be protected by stout exclusion fencing to be created before the commencement of the development and retained until completion of the development.  REASON:  To prevent damage to the trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1 and 4.5 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 "Trees and Development Guidelines." | The area beneath the spread of the branches of the trees to be retained as shown on the approved drawings shall not be used for the storage of building materials, plant, machinery or other items, or for vehicular access or for the burning of materials of any kind.  REASON:  To prevent damage to the trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan for The Environment 2004 policies 4.1 and 4.5 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 "Trees and Development Guidelines." | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years from the implementation of final planting has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.   REASON: To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1 and 4.5 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 "Trees and Development Guidelines". | Prior to commencement of works, details of number and layout of cycle parking for residential and office uses shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority.  The approved facilities shall be provided prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and shall be permanently retained.   REASON: To ensure that adequate cycle parking and associated facilities are available within the site in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policy 9.6 | Notwithstanding details shown of the car parking number and layout on drawing number 995/115F dated July 05, full details of the car parking layout for the office and residential uses, to include 8 disabled parking bays, 1 space for the City Car Club, and details of car park management, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The management arrangement shall be implemented as approved and the approved layout shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development. The marked out spaces shall thereafter be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose without the prior permission in writing of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of general highway safety on neighbouring roads in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.3, 9.1 and 9.8 and Supplementary Planning Document 7 "Car Clubs". | Notwithstanding details shown on drawing number 995/115F dated July 05, full details of the vehicular access to the site for any revised scheme (including swept path drawings for 2-way access, gradient of ramp and design and position of gate) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented as approved and thereafter retained.  REASON: To ensure that there is safe access to and within the site and in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of general highway safety on the neighbouring highway in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 9.1 and 9.9. | Details of a  Travel Plan, designed to manage the transport needs of residents, office staff and visitors to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any work on site. The details shall include the provision of a City Car Club, including the appointment of a Travel Plan coordinator, the distribution and cohabitation of parking spaces between different activities and other targets to be monitored by the LPA annually or a timetable as otherwise agreed by the LPA. The approved scheme shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained in operation thereafter.   REASON:  To ensure that the Council's policies on sustainability are met, to minimise car use and promote alternative modes of travel for residents, staff and visitors to and from the site in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policy 9.1 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 21 "Sustainable Transport: Green Travel Plans". | Notwithstanding details shown on drawing number 955/114F dated July05 detailing servicing from Colonial Drive, a management plan that incorporates a legal agreement for the transfer of waste from the holding area to the main storage area shall be submitted to and approved by the LPA prior to commencement of development.  The details shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: In the interest of highway and pedestrian safety and free flow of traffic on the neighbouring highways in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policy 9.1 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 "Refuse and Recycling Facilities". | Notwithstanding details shown on drawing number 955/114F dated July 05, details of the pedestrian refuge shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development and the approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that the design is acceptable in terms of highway and pedestrian safety requirements in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policy 9.1 | Full details of the method of construction to include details of foundations and phasing of construction works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the commencement of any works on site. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  REASON: To enable full consideration of the ecological implications of the development and to safeguard the trees on the site in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 3.8 and 4.5 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 "Trees and Development". | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding:NR35 Leq, 5mins, for plant which will operate during the period of 2300 - 0700 hrs weekdays and anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays.NR40 Leq,1hr for plant which is controlled by time switches only to run during the period 0700-2300hrs Mondays to Fridays,As measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first use and retained as first implemented thereafter in accord with manufacturer's specifications.  REASON: To protect the living and working conditions of occupiers of the site and surroundings in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1 and 4.11 and SPG 10 Noise and Vibration. | Details of access for people with disabilities to the office, residential, parking and external areas (to include 10% wheelchair residential units and all others to Lifetime Homes standards), shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development hereby permitted on the site, and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of the building hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.3 and 5.3 and SPG7 Accessible Ealing. | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods agreed with the Local Planning Authority and subsequently a risk assessment shall be prepared, following the CLEA guidance.  A scheme shall then be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority to describe the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of the contamination, and for the remedial works, which shall be implemented before any other works commence.   REASON: To protect health and safety of occupants of the development and users of this and neighbouring sites and the nature conservation interest of the adjoining Nature Reserve, in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 2.7, 3.8 and 4.1. | Details of a scheme to promote sustainability in building design shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works; the scheme shall be implemented as approved and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure that the development is sustainable in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 2.9 and 4.1. | Details of measures to provide at least 10% renewable energy on site for the development shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of development.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation and retained permanently.  REASON:  To ensure the proposal contributes to its energy requirements in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policy 2.9. | No deliveries for the office use shall be taken or dispatched from the site outside the hours of 7:00 to 20:00 hours Monday to Friday, 7:00 to 13:00  hours on Saturday and not at any time on Sundays or Public Holidays.  REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of adjoining flats, in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1 and 4.11. | Prior to commencement of development, details of the internal and external lighting of the building together with associated mitigation measures to control light spillage shall be submitted to and approved by the LPA.  The details shall be implemented as approved and permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the wildlife interests of the adjacent Gunnersbury Triangle Nature Reserve, in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 3.9 and 4.12. | Details of the layout and design of the building, car and cycle parking areas, hard and soft landscaping and bin storage areas, to comply with the aims and objectives of Secured By Design and Secured Car Parks award, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development (other than demolition, site clearance and survey work). The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.3 and 4.4. and Supplementary guidance 8 "Safer Ealing". | No development shall commence until details of a site construction method statement/management plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:  + proposed on-site construction worker parking + anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site + delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods) + dust suppression measures + wheel washing provisions + erosion protection measures for cuts + site security during construction + construction vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to   demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into    and emerge from the site in forward gear. + procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents + details of how the temporary vehicular access road will be removed    and re-instated, and the timing of such works  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason:  In the interests of the nature conservation interest of the adjoining site, the amenity of adjoining occupiers of the site and the users of the neighbouring highway in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.11 and 9.9. | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, details of a bat survey and action to protect any bats shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Any action as approved shall be implemented prior to commencement of any works.  REASON:  To protect any bats in the building to be demolished or using adjacent areas in accordance with the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policy 3.8 and Biodiversity Action Plan, and the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981. | Before the development is commenced, details of a tree survey and a method statement setting out the measures to protect the trees to be retained on this and neighbouring sites in accordance with BS 5837, and the means of constructing the buildings and associated over ground and underground services in the vicinity of the retained trees, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The development method statement, shall be complied with and will apply until the end of the construction period.  REASON:  To prevent damage to the protected trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.6 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 "Trees and Development Guidelines". | No construction work (other than demolition, site clearance and survey work) shall commence until an acoustic report has been submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority that details satisfactory noise attenuation measures within the design of the development for the benefit of the occupiers of the residential accommodation.  These details shall be incorporated into the development.  REASON.  In the interests of the amenity of future residents of the site in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policy 4.11 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 "Noise and Development". | The City Car Club agreed as part of the legal agreement shall be established prior to occupation of the residential part of the development hereby approved and shall be retained for the lifetime of the development unless otherwise agreed, in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON:  In the interests of traffic conditions of the local area, in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 9.1, 9.8 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 20 Sustainable Transport. | Those areas on the approved plans identified as offices shall be solely for the purposes falling within Class B1 (a) of the Town and Country Planning Use Class Order 1987 (as amended) and for no other purpose whatsoever unless planning permission has first been obtained via the submission of a planning application to the local authority.  REASON:  To ensure no separate or alternative use commences without prior consideration of the planning issues by the Local Planning Authority in the interests of safeguarding the amenities of the locality, in accordance with Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1, 6.1 and 9.1.
